content.description: This is the middle route on the slab. The crux is half way on the route. Move right at the small ledge, the further the better. After gaining the ledge thin edging continues. Initially the bolt after the ledge wasn't there giving the route a proper name, a bit runout on thin edging. I recently added a bolt there to tame it down making more like a house kitty.
content.location: Obvious bolt line in the middle of the slab. This whole slab consists of the best grade A granite.

content.description: Start at the base of the brown rock, pass a bolt and up to a horizontal crack (.5 cam). Move through the overlap heading for the white rock. Now your on the really fine granite. Take this to the roof and pull into the dihedral. An easier variation for the roof is going right of the bolt keeping the whole route at 5.7.
content.location: On the far left side of Claim Jumper Wall is a wide brown river of rock.

content.description: Climb up some grassy ledges to the first bolt and the panel steepens. From the 2nd bolt move right into the crux and continue delicate face climbing to a ledge. Easy traversing left to the next bolt and into the corner with a mantle ledge near the top. Pretty stout for a 5.9
content.location: From the large ledge at Fools Gold walk North until the ledge drops down to the beginning. Belay at a grassy ledge below the route. A 2" cam is useful at the belay.

content.description: Obvious bolt line on the left side of the slab. Crux is at the third bolt. About 10 quick draws will suffice. A short easy 2nd pitch will take you to grassy slopes and an anchor at about 80'. From here a short walk goes to Bat Wing.
content.location: First route on the main slab

content.description: After the first several bolts you reach a spike of rock to stand on. Past this is a ledge and about 10' above is a small crack which takes a perfect wired nut. This protects the next couple moves as you could hit the ledge if it wasn't placed. The climbing gets harder from here on. A 90' rappel gets you to a ledge and a walk off.
content.protection: about 12 bolts plus a medium wire
content.location: This is on the right side of the slab. Again, a bolt line starts from the ground.

content.description: Although short it is quality. Tricky moves from the start gets you past 2 bolts to a steep section and the third bolt. Above is a diagonal rail that takes a small cam or offset wire, or just run it to the anchor on easier climbing.
content.protection: 3 bolts, small cam or med. wire
content.location: A short distance uphill (north) from Claim Jumper is a short wall with several bolts at the start. Follow the trail at the base of the cliff.
